meanings.definition: A small Moroccan coin worth one-fifth of a dirham.
meanings.sent1: In Morocco, you can buy a sweet treat for a baiza.
meanings.sent2: I found a baiza on the street while walking to the market.
meanings.sent3: The baiza rolled away, playing hide and seek with the other coins.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as rare as finding a baiza in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The baiza shone like a tiny sun in the palm of his hand.

meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Oman, equal to 1/1000 of a rial.
meanings.sent1: She saved every baiza to buy a special gift for her mom.
meanings.sent2: The shopkeeper gave me change in baizas instead of rials.
meanings.sent3: The baiza danced in the air before landing in the donation box.
meanings.sent4: His generosity was like scattering baizas in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the baiza dropping echoed through the quiet street.
